snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is fielding offers to develop a casino in the city, a senior administration official said, and could face resistance from lawmakers.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo is fielding multiple offers from the gambling industry to develop a combination casino and convention center after abandoning plans to build the nation's largest convention center at the Aqueduct racetrack in Queens; proposals involve an array of locations throughout New York City, but Cuomo is angling for a development in Manhattan.

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and CHARLES V. BAGLI
byline.contributor: Danny Hakim reported from Albany, and Charles V. Bagli from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is fielding offers to develop a casino in the city, a senior administration official said, and could face resistance from lawmakers.

headline.seo: Cuomo Weighs Other Convention-Casino Complex Options in New York
headline.main: After Setback, Cuomo Weighs New Option for Convention-Casino Complex in City
headline.print_headline: After Setback, Cuomo Weighs New Option for Convention-Casino Complex in City
